name: Heart spider
description: Once per 5 rooms pumps the valunteer full of extra blood, healing 2d6 vigour

name: Finger worm
description: A long finger that perfectly finds nerves when making a nerve check, valunteer flips 2 sets of coins per finger worm and picks one, ignoring the other

name: Eyeslug
description: Replaces one eye with a large slug. When revealing a room, draw 2 per slug, then discard to 1.

name: Facestode
description: A wide layer of parasite that covers a volunteer’s face. When taking damage, roll 1d6 and reduce that damage taken by the amount.

name: Stomatone
description: A hole-shaped worm that connects a volunteer’s guts to the outside, letting them stuff an extra 30% of parasites into the hole. Their total can now reach +30% per stomatone.

name: Pinskin
description: A long-spined worm that covers a volunteer’s body, extending spines out of their body. When dealing damage, deal a further d6 damage per pinskin.

name: Angelclamp
description: Wide feathered parasites that latch onto a volunteer’s back, letting them fly briefly over holes and gaps in rooms.

name: Compassworm
description: A brain worm that vibrates based on cardinal direction. When moving to another room, look at +2 rooms per compassworm and rearrange them in any order.

name: Whaletongue
description: Latches onto a volunteer’s tongue, producing a soothing howl that reduces the Leviathan discomfort by 1 when discovering a new safe room.

name: Godsac
description: A golden sac that latches onto a volunteer’s armpit, healing 1 vigour per godsac per enemy defeated.
